content.description: Let random variable <math alttext="uppercase Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> represent the number of interviews conducted for job openings at a certain company. The following table shows the cumulative probability distribution of the discrete random variable <math alttext="uppercase Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>Y</mi></mrow></math>.
content.question: <math alttext="lowercase y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="the probability of uppercase Y is less than or equal to lowercase y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>P</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>Y</mi><mo>≤</mo><mi>y</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> 5 0 6 0.2 7 0.4 8 0.6 9 0.8 10 1.0 Khaleed claims that the distribution of <math alttext="uppercase Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>Y</mi></mrow></math> is skewed to the left with mean equal to 8 interviews. Is Khaleed’s claim correct?

choices.label: Yes, the distribution is skewed to the left with mean equal to 8 interviews.
No, the distribution is skewed to the left with mean greater than 8 interviews.
No, the distribution is skewed to the right with mean equal to 8 interviews.
No, the distribution is uniform with mean equal to 8 interviews.
No, the distribution is uniform with mean greater than 8 interviews.

content.answer: No, the distribution is uniform with mean equal to 8 interviews.

unit.text: 4: Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions

topic.text: 4.7: Introduction to Random Variables and Probability Distributions

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Interpret statistical calculations and findings to assign meaning or assess a claim.
